column1: The lake was once located in the central part of the State of Pennsylvania. It was perhaps a mile wide and more than that long and surrounded by mountains and long ranges of hills. At the lower end of the lake was a small settlement of scant importance and at the upper end
column2: where there was a stream of no mean size
column3: was the town of Riverside. At Riverside were situated several summer hotels and boarding houses
column4: and also the elegant mansion in which Ned Talmadge resided
column5: with his parents and his four sisters.Joe Bodley was as poor as Ned Talmadge was rich
column6: yet the two lads were quite friendly. Joe knew a good deal about hunting and fishing
column7: and also knew all about handling boats. They frequently went out together
column8: and Ned insisted upon paying the poorer boy for all extra services.Joe's home was located on the side of the mountain which was just now wrapped in such dark and ominous looking clouds. He lived with Hiram Bodley
column9: an old man who was a hermit. The home consisted of a cabin of two rooms
